At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand.
